title: Mojave Desert
summary: The Mojave Desert (/moʊˈhɑːvi, mə-/ moh-HAH-vee, mə-;[3][4][5] Mohave: Hayikwiir Mat'aar) is a xeric desert in the rain shadow of the Sierra Nevada mountains in the Southwestern United States.[6][7] It is named for the indigenous Mojave people. It is located primarily in southeastern California and southwestern Nevada, with small portions extending into Arizona and Utah.[8][7]
